ACAC766314BC457781D03D232A843407.description:
Given a two-way frequency table, calculate relative
frequencies for rows or columns.

1EBD7711450745BB9AB4C6DFBFC659B7.description:
Summarize bivariate categorical data in two-way frequency
tables. Interpret relative frequencies in the contexts of the data
(including joint, marginal, and conditional relative frequencies).
Recognize possible associations and trends in data.

4E3985EB9FF54CA2B12C5C2C279EC328.description:
Determine if the correlation coefficient, measured from 0 to
1, is a strong or weak correlation. (E)

E3098E9BDC214B7EAEE4C51C9DE2C789.description:
Use the line of best fit to find points that can be used to
answer questions about data. (E)

19910327EBD3404D9555CD73306E1FF2.description:
Use technology to find a linear function that models a
relationship between two quantitative variables to make predictions
and interpret the slope and y-intercept. Using technology, compute and
interpret the correlation coefficient. (E)

65E985E70336429FBAEA3E7534FD9D82.description:
Select the model that represents biased or unbiased
statistics and data and therefore might be misleading. (E)

7CE71C4C4E2E438B954317767268458E.description:
Understand that statistics and data are non-neutral and
designed to serve a particular interest. Analyze the possibilities for
whose interest might be served and how the representations might be
misleading. (E)

01354C1D124347FE9A6096AA7E0F3F9C.description:
Given a statistical situation, identify it as a sample survey,
experiment, or an observational study. Recognize the purpose of
using a random sample.

CE2084FA9680405BA9C2610AEE565807.description:
Interpret statistics as a process for making inferences about a
population based on a random sample from that population. Recognize
the purposes of and differences among sample surveys, experiments,
and observational studies; explain how randomization relates to each.
(E)

958BBB6F6D604E46843E32C22599D238.description:
Identify zeros of quadratic functions. Understand that
quadratic equations have 2, 1, or no real solutions.

3FB7FEBCD094441785ACC3085AC7E674.description:
Describe the relationships among a solution of a quadratic
equation, a zero of the function, an x-intercept of the graph, and the
factors of the expression. Explain that every quadratic has two
complex solutions, which may or may not be real solutions.

C231786FCDE94006A7327D91D10815FC.description:
Given a graph of an exponential and quadratic function
identify key features such as zeros and extreme values.

34726676B83E4B7A9D933C9355054A81.description:
Graph exponential and quadratic functions with the aid of
technology.

1F5EDFB6C10B481C87AEFE87EA1031DB.description:
Graph exponential and quadratic functions with and without
technology. Identify and describe key features, such as zeros, lines of
symmetry, and extreme values in real-world and other mathematical
problems involving quadratic functions with and without technology;
interpret the results in the real-world contexts.

449173E21FAE47669900295493D1A33F.description:
Using technology, determine if a point lies on a quadratic
function.

A87803FDE5794298B1956E700ACBCA5D.description:
Represent real-world problems using quadratic equations in
one or two variables and solve such problems with technology.
Interpret the solution(s), and determine whether they are reasonable.
(E)

616853DD81BA4DD293524C8C21C354A2.description:
Solve quadratic equations using square roots, factoring,
and the quadratic formula.

684974B478EC4F539EA037E94A3B01AE.description:
Solve quadratic equations in one variable by inspection (e.g.,
for x
2 = 49), finding square roots, using the quadratic formula, and
factoring, as appropriate to the initial form of the equation.

912E4FC4D75A4ED6B42FE2675E7D5250.description:
Represent real-world or mathematical problems of an
exponential equation of the form y = ab
x
, and identify the a-value as
the initial value (or y-intercept) and the b-value as the growth or decay
factor.

5F40FB393EDC471CA80F2FCCD4381DB6.description:
Represent real-world and other mathematical problems that
can be modeled with simple exponential functions using tables,
graphs, and equations of the form y = ab
x
(for integer values of x > 1,
rational values of b > 0 and b ≠ 1 ) with and without technology;
interpret the values of a and b.

BA2A81E477454952928D46DAA9E564BE.description:
Identify a function as linear or exponential given a graph,
table, or real-world problem. Understand that linear functions grow by
equal differences and exponential functions grow by equal factors.
(E)

764D97D7460C47C68B3B8E8B4DD0C1F2.description:
Distinguish between situations that can be modeled with
linear functions and exponential functions. Understand that linear
functions grow by equal differences over equal intervals, and that
exponential functions grow by equal factors over equal intervals.
Compare linear functions and exponential functions that model
real-world situations using tables, graphs, and equations. (E)

F3356FE5997147599590D258C9D2C571.description: Quadratic and Exponential Equations and Functions

3C7BD25F24D647E588C6AA9A16563622.description: Identify the solution set to a system of inequalities.

4D1FF5E841E34639B6DF6B07735316AF.description:
Identify a system of linear inequalities that represents a
given real-world problem.

B8FF649CCB9F4B3FA59C97CEC0CD8BA9.description:
Represent real-world problems using a system of two linear
inequalities in two variables. Graph the solution set to a system of
linear inequalities in two variables as the intersection of the
corresponding half-planes with and without technology. Interpret the
solution set, and determine whether it is reasonable.

7395A473A8F24D65964D26F9595784DB.description:
Graph a system of linear equations that represents a
real-world problem and determine the reasonableness of the solution.
Identify a solution to a system of linear equations. (E)

D1C094851CCC48959F46C013A7BE17F9.description:
Write and graph a system of two linear equations in two
variables that represents a real-world problem and solve the problem
graphically and algebraically with and without technology. Interpret the
solution, and determine whether the solution is reasonable. (E)

887988CF0AF841EB99C30D473068B6CF.description:
Identify solutions to real-world linear inequalities given the
graph. (E)

0726F9D9271C4706BE52DDA335C8FB68.description:
Identify a two-variable linear inequality that represents a
real-world problem. (E)

A6498CF30EAC4219A408F3BE465973C0.description:
Represent real-world problems using linear inequalities in
two variables and solve such problems; interpret the solution set, and
determine whether it is reasonable. Graph the solutions to a linear
inequality in two variables as a half-plane. (E)

863FD72A15A94F9B99C7FFA1C8C3B193.description: Systems of Linear Equations and Inequalities

5C8D64D5807D4F2385ECFAD5020FBED2.description:
Solve linear and quadratic equations, including formulas, for a
specified variable limited to simple quadratic formulas (e.g., A = pi*r
2
).

25B6B9C1EDB84F1AA3D7F1FE75BB055C.description:
Solve linear and quadratic equations and formulas for a
specified variable to highlight a quantity of interest, using the same
reasoning as in solving equations. (E)

458E42D876E440E28AB8722C12D73CC6.description:
Represent real-world problems that can be modeled with a
linear function (in slope-intercept form) using equations, graphs, and
tables. (E)

13BF7086D2674596AD877AE7FE9173B9.description:
Represent real-world problems that can be modeled with a
linear function using equations, graphs, and tables, including with
technology. Translate fluently among these representations and
interpret the slope and intercepts. (E)

2DA63179638A48AEBFDCD18801CC9EAD.description:
Represent linear functions using multiple representations.
Recognize equations of lines in multiple forms (slope-intercept form
and standard form). Describe the attributes revealed by various forms
of linear functions.

789AC84BEC724155B041E23CC36C7D20.description:
Represent linear functions as graphs from equations (with
emphasis on technology), equations from graphs, and equations from
tables and other given information (e.g., from a given point on a line
and the slope of the line). Find the equations of a line in a
slope-intercept, point-slope, and standard forms. Recognize that
different forms reveal more or less information about a given situation
based on the form used.

B352E385DE90444FABF82072513745CA.description:
Solve multi-step linear equations and inequalities in one
variable. (E)

857C556A3C5F403B99EDB32E6BC38927.description:
Write a one-variable equation or inequality given a
word-problem. (E)

9F81550117B34A36B69CCEB4FC72BFCB.description:
Represent real-world problems using linear equations and
inequalities in one variable, including those with rational number
coefficients and variables on both sides of the equal sign. Solve them
fluently, explaining the process used and justify the choice of a solution
method. (E)

35A4E2179FFA4431A0761268470E10D2.description:
Given the graph of a function, identify its key features
(domain, range, intercept(s), increasing, and decreasing). Given the
key features (domain, range, increasing, and decreasing) of a
function, determine the graph that indicates the key feature. Identify
independent and dependent variables of a function. (E)

FB50A179431B4D2294826358A09F1BA8.description:
Describe, qualitatively, the functional relationship between two
quantities by analyzing key features of a graph. Sketch a graph that
exhibits given key features of a function that has been verbally
described, including intercepts, where the function is increasing or
decreasing, where the function is positive or negative, and any relative
maximum or minimum values. Identify the independent and dependent
variables. (E)

0C20ACE9D91549369B00742A6365FB99.description: Evaluate functions for given elements of the domain.

5FA5DD409E1C41AC8939633CF968429A.description:
Evaluate functions for given elements of the domain, and
interpret statements in function notation in terms of a context.

C2691980F1714A8CB84B588D69A26592.description:
Identify the domain and range of a table or graph.
Understand the domain is the independent variable and the range is
the dependent variable. (E)

A65BAA37550940618C84F80FEB19A4FB.description:
Extend understanding of independent/dependent variables to
encompass domain/range, as applied to relations using tables, graphs,
verbal descriptions, and equations. (E)

E0B4C2B32A074667AA0323A387FC5860.description: Add, subtract, and multiply monomials and binomials. (E)

0DDF4BE8E4E54A6687396F0666E47C6B.description:
Add, subtract, and multiply polynomials. Divide polynomials
by monomials. Use these operations to rewrite algebraic expressions
in equivalent forms, and justify them with algebraic properties. (E)

6DD0B41F947742EF94E38767D762D84A.description: Simplify square roots of non-perfect square whole numbers.

2CA8925D6A0F4A4C976B62D52D406E26.description:
Simplify square roots of monomial algebraic expressions,
including non-perfect squares.
